title: Number of earthquakes in Italy 2018 - 2019 , by magnitude
summary: This is a bar chart representing Magnitude in the x axis and Number of earthquakes in the y axis.
Magnitude Magnitude 0+ has the highest Number of earthquakes and Magnitude 5.5+ has the lowest Number of earthquakes.
There is a difference of 21869.0 between the maximum Magnitude Magnitude 0+ and minimum Magnitude Magnitude 5.5+.
min_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Magnitude, and Number of earthquakes in each Magnitude on the y axis.
The Number of earthquakes is highest at Magnitude Magnitude 0+ and lowest at Magnitude Magnitude 5.5+.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Magnitude in the x axis and Number of earthquakes in the y axis.
Magnitude Magnitude 0+ has the highest Number of earthquakes and Magnitude 5.5+ has the lowest Number of earthquakes.
There is a difference of 21869.0 between the maximum Magnitude Magnitude 0+ and minimum Magnitude Magnitude 5.5+.
max_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Magnitude, and Number of earthquakes in each Magnitude on the y axis.
The Number of earthquakes is highest at Magnitude Magnitude 0+ and lowest at Magnitude Magnitude 5.5+.
Second maximum Number of earthquakes is found at Magnitude Magnitude 2+.
The minimum Magnitude Magnitude 5.5+ has got 2186900000000000.2 times less Number of earthquakes than the maximum Magnitude Magnitude 0+.
Number of earthquakes at Magnitude Magnitude 0+ is 21869.0 , second place is Magnitude 2+ at 2384.0, and thirdly is Magnitude 3+ at 226.0.
The Magnitude Magnitude 5.5+ has 4.46 times less Number of earthquakes than average.
Summing up the values of all Magnitudes, we get total 24499.0.
